Description: Limestone ostracon; one side: full-face sketches in red & black; other side: Coptic inscription palimpsest over similar faces in red.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Henri Édouard Naville (1893-94, on behalf of EEF)
Bibliographic references: Godlewski 1986 / Le monastère de St Phoibammon (p.108, fig.50)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (390564) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/390564)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Crum 321 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Deir el-Bahari dessin 9 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
